page_analysis.text_content:
Allowable extensions to existing encroachments

Fig 19 Allowable extensions of existing walls that encroach into required yards (on ground floor only)

A Extension of existing side yard
encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the
required interior side yard setback but is at
least 5'-0" from the property line, may be
extended at the same setback, in one
direction only, at the ground floor only, for a
distance equal to the length of the existing
wall or 20' whichever is less.
Note: In the example below, two existing
walls are encroaching--only one of them
may be extended.

Rear yard

15'
min.

Interior-side yard

Interior-side yard

Interior-side
yard

B Extension of existing front yard
encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the
required front yard setback but is at least
14'-0" from the property line, may be
extended at the same setback, in one
direction only, at the ground floor only, with
both of the following provisions:
1) the length of the extension is no greater
than that of the existing encroaching wall,
2) the combined length is no greater than
one-half the maximum width of the house.

Rear yard

Interior-side yard

Interior-side yard

C Extension of existing street-side
yard encroachment
An existing wall that encroaches into the
required street side yard setback but is at
least 10'-0" from the property line, may be
extended at the same setback, in one
direction only, at the ground floor only, for a
distance equal to the length of the existing
wall or 20' whichever is less.

Rear yard

Street-side yard

Note:
• Encroaching walls that
don't meet the minimim
setback given for each
case i.e., 5', 14, and 10',
may not be extended nor
may they may not be
stepped back and then
extended.

• Multiple protrusions are
not permitted; addition
must be contiguous with
existing protrusion.

• Only for structures that
were legally constructed,
without a variance or an
home-improvement
exception (HIE).

• Only once in the life of the
structure.

• Requires retention of the
non- complying wall.

Exceptions apply to special
setbacks as well.

Key

Only one of the two
encroaching walls may
be extended

Front yard

14'
min

Front
yard

10'
min.

Front yard

encroaching wall max.

the building max.

visual_elements.description: Three plan view diagrams (A, B, C) illustrating allowable extensions to existing encroachments into required yards. Each diagram shows a property layout with a 'Rear yard', 'Front yard', and 'Interior-side yard' or 'Street-side yard'. The diagrams depict an 'Existing house' (light grey) and an 'Addition' (dark grey) extending into setback areas. Dashed lines indicate 'Required setback' and solid lines indicate 'Lot line'. A patterned area represents 'Sidewalk' and a light grey area represents 'Buildable area'.
visual_elements.location: Middle to bottom of the page

visual_elements.description: Diagram A: Shows an existing house with two walls encroaching into the interior-side yard. An arrow points to one of the encroaching walls with the text 'Only one of the two encroaching walls may be extended'. A dimension line indicates '5' min.' from the property line to the setback.
visual_elements.location: Left side, middle of the page

visual_elements.description: Diagram B: Shows an existing house with a wall encroaching into the front yard. An addition is shown extending from the existing encroaching wall. Dimension lines indicate '14' min' from the property line to the setback, 'Length of existing encroaching wall max.' for the addition's length, and 'Half the width of the building max.' for the addition's width.

Diagram C: Shows an existing house with a wall encroaching into the street-side yard. An addition is shown extending from the existing encroaching wall. A dimension line indicates '10' min.' from the property line to the setback.
visual_elements.location: Right side, middle of the page

visual_elements.description:
Key for the diagrams, defining line types and shaded areas:
- Solid line: Lot line
- Dashed line: Required setback
- Light grey patterned area: Buildable area
- Dark grey patterned area: Sidewalk
- Light grey solid area: Existing house
- Dark grey solid area: Addition

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum interior side yard setback for extension
Maximum extension length for side yard encroachment
Minimum front yard setback for extension

technical_specifications.value: no greater than that of the existing encroaching wall

technical_specifications.parameter: Maximum combined length for front yard encroachment (provision 2)
technical_specifications.value: one-half the maximum width of the house

technical_specifications.parameter: Minimum street side yard setback for extension
Maximum extension length for street side yard encroachment
Minimum setback for street side yard (Note)

subheadings: A Extension of existing side yard encroachment
B Extension of existing front yard encroachment
C Extension of existing street-side yard encroachment

additional_notes: Page number '25' is present at the bottom right corner.
The text 'minimim' in the first bullet point under 'Note:' appears to be a typo and should likely be 'minimum'.
